intro: Harrachia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny harrachia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and sharp, spiny leaves that provide protection against herbivores. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Harrachia spinosa thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its adaptations to harsh climates make it an important component of local ecosystems.
